intro: Adenophora liliifolia f. genuina, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers and herbaceous growth habit. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of blue to violet flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens.
